name: JellyScout
description: A simplified Jellyfin plugin for movie and TV show discovery with TMDB integration and optional Sonarr/Radarr support for automated downloads.
overview: JellyScout helps you discover movies and TV shows using The Movie Database (TMDB) and optionally add them to your Sonarr or Radarr instances for automated downloading. This version has been significantly simplified to focus on core functionality and compatibility with Jellyfin's plugin system.

This is a bug fix release that addresses issues users were experiencing with the configuration page where settings would not save and data would be lost on page refresh.

üé¨ STREAMING FUNCTIONALITY ADDED

‚ú® NEW FEATURES:
‚Ä¢ Added Prowlarr integration for torrent search
‚Ä¢ Added BitPlay integration for streaming via torrent
‚Ä¢ Stream buttons appear on content with sufficient seeders
‚Ä¢ Automatic download queuing when streaming starts
‚Ä¢ Real-time torrent availability checking
‚Ä¢ Streaming modal with embedded BitPlay player
‚Ä¢ Torrent health indicators (seeders, quality, size)

üîß TECHNICAL IMPROVEMENTS:
‚Ä¢ New ProwlarrService for torrent search API

‚Ä¢ Enhanced web interface with streaming controls
‚Ä¢ Streaming modal with iframe player
‚Ä¢ Torrent availability checking endpoint
‚Ä¢ Stream start/stop functionality
‚Ä¢ Configuration for minimum seeders threshold

‚öôÔ∏è CONFIGURATION:

üéØ USAGE:

This version transforms JellyScout from a simple discovery tool into a complete streaming solution while maintaining backward compatibility with existing download functionality.

üîÑ MAJOR ARCHITECTURAL REWRITE - SIMPLIFIED VERSION

‚úÖ FIXED ISSUES:
‚Ä¢ Fixed plugin icon not showing in admin panel
‚Ä¢ Fixed configuration page loading with JavaScript errors  
‚Ä¢ Removed authorization policies that were blocking access
‚Ä¢ Completely rewritten configuration page using Jellyfin's built-in APIs
‚Ä¢ Simplified controller from 1,739 lines to 304 lines (83% reduction)

üèóÔ∏è ARCHITECTURAL CHANGES:
‚Ä¢ Removed custom configuration endpoints (now uses Jellyfin's built-in system)
‚Ä¢ Removed complex playlist management (let Jellyfin handle playlists)
‚Ä¢ Removed queue management (let Jellyfin handle queues)
‚Ä¢ Removed streaming/torrent functionality (too complex for a plugin)
‚Ä¢ Removed health monitoring (not needed for a plugin)
‚Ä¢ Simplified to 8 core API endpoints instead of 50+

‚ö° CORE FUNCTIONALITY PRESERVED:

‚Ä¢ Media details retrieval
‚Ä¢ Add content to Sonarr (TV shows)
‚Ä¢ Add content to Radarr (movies)

‚Ä¢ Plugin status monitoring

üîß TECHNICAL IMPROVEMENTS:

This version focuses on being a reliable, simple plugin that does movie/TV discovery well, rather than trying to be a complete media management platform.

CRITICAL FIX: Fixed plugin image serving endpoint to resolve 404 errors on plugin icons. Fixed embedded resource path resolution. Both plugin icons and configuration pages should now work properly.

FINAL FIX: Corrected configuration page naming so settings work properly, removed unnecessary debug files (.pdb) for cleaner plugin structure. Configuration page should now open correctly when clicking plugin settings.

MAJOR FIX: Added plugin image controller to serve icons properly, fixed configuration page name for proper settings access, corrected plugin structure to match Jellyfin standards. Icons should now display correctly and settings should be accessible.

Enhanced TMDB API integration with dynamic image configuration, trending/popular content support, language/region localization, improved error handling, and real-time download status tracking. Added new API endpoints for trending and popular content discovery.
Fixed version display issue (was showing 0.0.0.0) and included plugin icon. Plugin should now show correct version number and display icon properly.
Fixed configuration page naming issue. Settings should now open the correct configuration page instead of redirecting to catalog.
Fixed configuration page loading issue and corrected plugin GUID. Configuration page should now work properly in Jellyfin admin.

Complete rewrite with modern architecture, API integration, and enhanced features. Added comprehensive API integration with Streamio, Sonarr, and Radarr. Implemented advanced filtering, playlist support, and configuration validation.
Initial development version with basic TMDB integration and streaming capabilities
